definition: to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
cut off the feet/rising to a height/towering/bald

sentences.english: Stream north Huping cliff, towering cliffs, towering like a bottle-shaped pot and name.
sentences.chinese: 澗北有壺瓶崖，危崖萬丈，突兀類壺瓶狀而名。

sentences.english: Painters were hired to try and blend the huge, obtrusive towers into the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 受僱的畫家嘗試着將突兀的巨塔融入周圍的風景之中。

sentences.english: Notifications are non-obtrusive and served only during the day time.
sentences.chinese: 通知是不突兀和服務只在白天的時間。

sentences.english: Here, too, the trajectory will be more sudden and stark than most reporting suggests.
sentences.chinese: 發展的軌跡會比大多的報道暗示的更爲突兀和荒涼。

sentences.english: Victories — and defeats — don't come any tougher than this.
sentences.chinese: 勝利與失敗從沒來得像這次這般突兀過。

sentences.english: Elephant Trunk Hill juts out into the Li River where it joins the Peach Blossom River.
sentences.chinese: 象鼻山在灕江與桃花河交匯處突兀地顯現出來。

sentences.english: I just don’t like how an SLR is big and heavy and obtrusive.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡那種單反鏡頭又大又沉又突兀的相機。

sentences.english: The Baiquan mountain has towering peaks, it's a magnificent scene.
sentences.chinese: 百泉山上奇峯突兀，景色壯觀。

sentences.english: It is also critical that the slope between the levels be flat and not convex or humped.
sentences.chinese: 另外，兩層之間平緩不突兀也是至關重要的。

sentences.english: That old building looks out of place in this up-scale neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 那棟舊建築物在這個高級住宅區裏顯得很突兀。

definition: lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom)/fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction/minor details obscure the main point/the sauce is better than the fish
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
